section.p: The Functional Status Section provides information about the capability of the patient to perform acts of daily living.

ol.li: SHALL conform to CCD Functional Status Section template (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.5)
SHALL conform to CCD Functional Status Section template (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.5)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code/@code="47420-5" Functional status assessment (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.6.1 LOINC)

SHOULD satisfy: Contains one or more Problem Act and/or Result Organizer (CONF-123)
[OCL]: self.getEntryTargets(ccd::ProblemAct)->size() > 0 or self.getEntryTargets(ccd::ResultOrganizer)->size() > 0
SHOULD satisfy: Contains a case-insensitive language-insensitive string containing 'functional status'.
problem observation or result observation in the functional status section SHALL contain exactly one observation / code (CONF-128)

The value for Observation / code in a problem observation or result observation in the functional status section MAY be selected from ValueSet 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20.6 FunctionalStatusTypeCode STATIC 20061017

If the functional status was collected using a standardized assessment instrument, then the instrument itself SHOULD be represented in the Organizer / code of a result organizer, with a value selected from LOINC (codeSystem 2.16.840.1.113883.6.1) or SNOMED CT (codeSystem 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96)

If the functional status was collected using a standardized assessment instrument, then the question within that instrument SHOULD be represented in the Observation / code of a result observation, with a value selected from LOINC (codeSystem 2.16.840.1.113883.6.1) or SNOMED CT (codeSystem 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96).

If the functional status was collected using a standardized assessment instrument containing questions with enumerated values as answers, then the answer SHOULD be represented in the Observation / value of a result observation
If Observation / value in a result observation in the functional status section is of data type CE or CD, then it SHOULD use the same code system used to code the question in Observation / code.

Observation / value in a result observation in the functional status section MAY be of datatype CE or CD and MAY contain one or more Observation / value / translation, to represent equivalent values from other code systems.

A problem observation or result observation in the functional status section MAY use codes from the International Classification of Functioning, Disability, and Health (ICF, http://www.who.int/classifications/icf/en/) (codeSystem 2.16.840.1.113883.6.254).
A problem observation in the functional status section SHALL contain exactly one status of functional status observation
A result observation in the functional status section SHALL contain exactly one status of functional status observation.
